data.text:
A list of movie trailer, TV spot, radio spot, promo, commercial and miscellaneous narrations from Don LaFontaine (19402008), who is known to be the most famous trailer narrator of all time.

102 Dalmatians (2000)[]

Teaser #1[]

"It's been 3 long years...since the incident. 36 months to relive every detail...1,095 days to think about what went wrong...and 26,280 hours to plot revenge...that's 11,037,600 minutes...in dog years."

"Glenn Close...in Walt Disney Pictures' 102 Dalmatians. Next Thanksgiving, it's a brand new tail."

Trailer[]

"Cruella de Vil has been cured. She's making the most of a second chance. Unfortunately, temptation has a brand new face."

"From Walt Disney Pictures. This Thanksgiving, get ready for a brand new tail. Glenn Close. Disney's 102 Dalmatians."

Video Trailer[]

"Cruella de Vil has been cured. Unfortunately, temptation has a brand new face."

"From Walt Disney Pictures. Get ready...for a brand new tail. Glenn Close. Disney's 102 Dalmatians. Coming to video and Disney DVD, Spring 2001. (Alt: Now on video and Disney DVD.)"

2001: A Space Odyssey (1968) Trailer[]

"Millions of years ago...Before the human race existed. An adventure began. An adventure that ultimately leads man to confront his own destiny in an odyssey of exploration. A Shrieking Monolith deliberately buried by an alien intelligence starts man on a mission half a billion miles into space. With 3 of its 5 Crew asleep in hibernation, Spacecraft Discovery One voyages towards Jupiter. Controlling the mission is a talking computer known as HAL. In the first year of the 21st Century there is strange and wondrous beauty. Starling experiences that jolt and mystify. And the danger of complete obliteration. And now...your journey is just beginning."

20th Century Fox Selections Promos[]

1995[]

"Introducing 20th Century Fox Selections. A collection of twelve new movies every season. Each available for a limited time only. All for under $10."

"20th Century Fox Selections. Great entertainment. Top stars. Big savings. For a limited time only. Look for them. You're gonna love them."

1997[]

3 Hollywood Video Commercials (1998)[]

Scream 2[]

"From Dimension Home Video. Scream 2. Rated R."

Spawn[]

"From flesh to steel..."

Good Will Hunting[]

"From Miramax Home Entertainment. Good Will Hunting. Rated R."

54 (1998) Trailer[]

"Imagine a place where fantasies became reality, where anything could happen, and everything did. Not long ago, one place really did make dreams come true."

"He was a working class kid from a small town in New Jersey, until he crossed the river into New York City...and entered a world overflowing with luxury, desire and decadence. A night club that was nothing less than the center of the universe...Studio 54."

"Miramax Films is proud to present, the sexiest movie of the year. Ryan Phillippe, Selma Hayek, with Neve Campbell, and Mike Myers. 54. Welcome to the party."

976-EVIL (1988) Trailer[]

"From director Robert 'Freddy Krueger' Englund comes a terrifying new film..."

"976-EVIL. Don't pick up the phone."

All About the Benjamins (2002) Trailer[]

The Abyss (1989)[]

Teaser[]

"In 1984, director James Cameron thrilled audiences with his vision of the future, The Terminator. In 1986, he created the science-fiction masterpiece, Aliens. This summer, he will take you into a world no man has ever seen before."

"The Abyss. Believe your eyes."

Trailer[]

"It began two years ago in an unfinished nuclear power plant. It became one of the most challenging motion pictures ever made. And on August 9th, the most original adventure of the summer will begin at theaters everywhere. From James Cameron, the writer and director of The Terminator and Aliens comes The Abyss."

Access Hollywood Promos[]

The Accused (1988) Trailer[]

"On April 18, 1987, Sarah Tobias stopped for a drink at a bar called the Mill."

"Now, she's fighting the system...where the guilty are protected...the pain is forgotten...the crime is negotiable."

"For Sarah, the night lives on...for Kathryn, the challenge begins. Kelly McGillis...Jodie Foster...The Accused."

Aces: Iron Eagle 3 (1992) TV Spot[]

"Their mission, unofficial. Their target, unauthorized, their courage, unbelievable. Aces: Iron Eagle 3. The best and final mission. Rated R. Starts Friday, June 12 at a theater near you."

Ace Ventura: Pet Detective (1994) Trailer[]

"They've faced incredible odds and unbeatable enemies to earn the name hero. But now, there's a new way to spell action."

"Jim Carrey is Ace Ventura: Pet Detective. He's the best there is. Actually, he's the only one there is."

"Now, the mascot of the Miami Dolphins has been kidnapped...and he's on the case of a lifetime."

"There's no place he won't go...nothing he won't do...and no one he can't handle."

"Because when this pet detective gets the scent...he'll follow it anywhere."

"Jim Carrey is...Ace Ventura: Pet Detective."

Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls (1995)[]

Teaser Trailer[]

"The great plains of Africa. The cradle of civilization. A place where there exists of balance between nature and man. So ancient. So sacred. No man would dare to disturb it. No man...but Ace Ventura!"

"Jim Carrey...Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls."

Theatrical Trailer[]

"In the deepest jungles of Africa, two tribes will fight a savage war unless a sacred animal god is found. So they're sending for the only man who can help."

"Jim Carrey is Ace Ventura, Pet Detective. Now...he will embark on a delicate mission...to help a people untouched by civilization."

"Blind to fear and immune to pain...he'll gain the respect of the tribe...discover the animal within...and answer when nature calls."

"Ace Ventura is in Africa...and Africa will never be the same. Jim Carrey...Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls."

Act of Vengeance (1986) Trailer[]

An Adventure Into the 3rd Dimension: The Making of Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over (2003 Documentary)[]

"In his latest film, director Robert Rodriguez revolutionizes the way films are made, taking the audience on an adventure into a whole new dimension, the 3rd dimension in Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over. In the next half-hour, we'll uncover the groundbreaking technology that transports the audience right in the middle of the action and take a look at the history of 3-D films. We'll go behind the scenes with the cast and crew and get a look at what it takes to create the video game world of Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over."

"Since its invention in 1838, stereoscopy has been used to create the illusion of a 3rd dimension. It is believed the first 3-D film is the French film, The Train Leaving the Station, filmed in 1903 by the Lumire brothers. Audiences panicked because they thought the train was about to crash right into them. The technology evolved over the years, leading to a 3-D boom in the 1950s."

The Adventures of Ford Fairlane (1990) Trailer[]

"A rock star is dead, a groupie has disappeared and millions are missing. These were his kind of odds, his name Ford Fairlane. A detective who's so smooth, he's arrow-dynamic, everyone knows him, everyone owns him and nothing they say can throw him. But this case could put him back in the black. But when your beat is the music business, you keep notes on everyone."

"Priscella Presley, Ed O'Neal, Robert Englund, Tone Loc, Gilbert Gottfried, Sheila E. and Wayne Newton. Yes, Wayne Newton. Andrew Dice Clay is Ford Fairlane. In a movie so hot, you'd better bring protection."

"Ford Fairlane. Coming in July to theaters everywhere."

The Adventures of Indiana Jones: The Complete DVD Movie Collection Trailer[]

"There are some treasures that should be left buried. Some artifacts better left undisturbed. And some you've been waiting years to open."

"At last, the complete adventures of Indiana Jones arrives on DVD."

"From legendary filmmakers George Lucas and Steven Spielberg and starring Harrison Ford comes this extraordinary 4-disc collection which includes all three films. Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark. Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom. Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade. Now you can each of these epic adventures like you've never seen them before. Digitally restored frame by frame and remastered for the ultimate picture quality and for the first time ever, remixed in 5.1 surround to give you unsurpassed sound."

"To bring you even more adventure, Lucasfilm has delved deep into their archives to produce an amazing 4th disc loaded with never-before-seen features that you will treasure forever."

"This October, bring home the ultimate hero in the ultimate adventures on the ultimate format in the ultimate collection."

"The Adventures of Indiana Jones: The Complete DVD Movie Collection. Own it October 21."

The Adventures of Pluto Nash (2002) Trailer[]

"239,000 miles from Earth in the blackness of space. There is a giant rock called the Moon. And the year 2087, its future will be in the hands of one man. Eddie Murphy is (Pluto Nash. Pluto? Pluto Nash! It is a pleasure to meet me) This summer, the battle between pretty evil and pretty good begins. Eddie Murphy. The Adventures of Pluto Nash."

The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle (2000) Trailer[]

"This summer, evil meets its moose. A criminal mastermind threatens to take over the world. (Fearless Leader: Are you talking to me?) What? (Fearless Leader: Are you talking to me?) No, I'm talking about you. (Fearless Leader: And I'm the only one here, so you must be talking to me.) Okay. Anyway."

"The only hope for humanity is a 400-pound talking moose...and a flying squirrel."

"They may not have a clue...but when the world needs a hero...they'll give it everything they've got."

"This summer, the fur will fly, the moose will drive...and the world will discover...this is not the same old bull."

"The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle."

Airplane! (1980)[]

1980 Trailer[]

"Stand by for the most extraordinary chain of events ever swept up into high adventure... Airplane! Airplane is drama...Airplane is action...Airplane is romance...Airplane is music...Airplane is dancing."

"Never has the screen been so big...Peter Graves...Kareem Abdul-Jabbar...Leslie Nielsen...Lloyd Bridges...Robert Stack...Julie Hagerty...Robert Hays."

"The most incredible adventure the screen has ever created...the big news is... Airplane!"

2005 Don't Call Me Shirley Edition Trailer[]

"The ultimate disaster comedy DVD is ready for takeoff: Airplane! Don't Call Me Shirley Edition DVD. Get back on board with the crew of Airplane!...now with everything you loved about the original...one of the funniest movies ever is now the over-the-top DVD you have to own...flying high with special features you won't see anywhere else, including behind-the-scenes footage from the control tower...and first-class deleted scenes."

"Get your hands on Airplane! Don't Call Me Shirley Edition DVD...coming soon."

The Alfred Hitchcock Collection Promo[]

"As famous as the stars he directed, Alfred Hitchcock has inspired a generation of filmmakers, revolutionized an entire genre and in the process became a legend around the world. On the 100th Anniversary of his birth, Universal Studios Home Video is proud to present The Alfred Hitchcock Collection. 13 of his greatest movies (includes Vertigo, Marnie, Rope, Topaz, Shadow of a Doubt, Frenzy, The Birds, Torn Curtain, Family Plot, Saboteur, The Man Who Knew Too Much, The Trouble with Harry, Psycho), newly remastered in all-new collectible packaging. Plus, bonus footage and theatrical trailers. And as part of the celebration, you can receive special savings of up to $5. Look inside each package for details. The Universal Studios Home Video's Alfred Hitchcock Collection. Available to own today."

Alien Nation (1988) Trailer[]

"The newcomers had arrived. They have their own customs, their own mysteries and their own crimes. Now, James Caan and Mandy Patinkin are headed deep into Newcomer Territory into the heart of a mystery inside an alien world of violence, desire and power beyond their darkest fears lies an evil beyond imagination. Alien Nation."

Aliens (1986) Trailer[]

"Aliens. This time, it's war."

Aliens vs. Predator (1999) Video Game Trailer[]

"This spring...the deadliest creatures in the universe will meet their match... Each other."

"Three hunters. One universe. You decide who will survive. Aliens vs. Predator. Only for your PC, from Fox Interactive."

An Alan Smithee Film: Burn Hollywood Burn (1998) Video Trailer[]

"The most anticipated motion picture event of the year. Hollywood's hardest hitting action stars. A white-knuckle thrill ride. There's just one problem with this movie...the director doesn't want you to see it."

"Hollywood Pictures Home Video presents the film that takes aim at Tinseltown. An Alan Smithee Film: Burn Hollywood Burn.

"The Hollywood Reporter raves it's one of the funniest movies in ages...and L.A. Weekly calls it hilarious."

"Jackie Chan, Ryan O'Neal, Chuck D., Richard Jeni, Sandra Bernhard, Coolio, Eric Idle and written by Joe Eszterhas. Why? An Alan Smithee Film: Burn Hollywood Burn."

Almost Blue (1993) Demo VHS Trailer[]

Always (1989) Trailer[]

"He was the luckiest flyer alive. Then one day, in a world of fire, nothing is forever, but a love can last. They thought that their world had ended, this had only just begun. From director Steven Spielberg, Always."

The Amateur (1981) TV Spot[]

Amazing Stories: Book One Promotional Preview[]

American Ninja (1985)[]

Trailer[]

"For 2,000 years, the sacred art of the ninja has been guarded in the East. Now, it has come to the West."

"He is the only soldier...the only American...who is capable of defeating the secret Black Star Army."

"The mission to hijack U.S. military arsenal...the adventure...the confrontation...the code...the invasion...the final hour."

"The deadliest art of the Orient is now in the hands of an American. American Ninja."

TV Spot[]

"He is the only soldier...who is capable of defeating the secret Black Star Army. A soldier who has become the master ninja. The deadliest art of the Orient is now in the hands of an American. American Ninja."

The Amityville Curse (1990) Trailer[]

"Three years ago, an unspeakable terror ripped the town of Amityville. Now, this house of possession has indeed tenants. And within this house, the past haunts the present. A past that will not die. A past that holds an ancient curse that strikes the living. The Amityville Curse."

Anguish (1987) Trailer[]

"Mrs. Pressman had high hopes for her son John. But the world conspired against him...until John found a way to please his mother...add to his collection...and even get into the movies."

"Anguish."

"Anguish."

Another Stakeout (1993) Trailer[]

"Detectives Chris Lacey and Bill Rhymers had a distinguished reputation, but they're about to face the biggest challenge of their career. Now, they have a new partner, they have a new identity and they're undercover as the average American family. If we can just get off each other's case, they might solve this one. Touchstone Pictures presents Richard Dreyfuss, Emilio Estevez and Rosie O'Donnell in a John Badham movie, Another Stakeout."

The Apostle (1997) Video Trailer[]

"The apostle. He was touched by the power and filled with the spirit. A man of faith. A man of the flesh. A man about to fall into a hell of his own making. The New York Times declares 'Robert Duvall's performance is volcanic.' New York Magazine calls it 'spellbinding'. And Siskel and Ebert give it 'two thumbs up. A triumph.' Experience Academy Award winner Robert Duvall, Farrah Fawcett, and Academy Award winner Billy Bob Thornton in the film over 75 of America's top critics call 'one of the best films of the year.' Don't miss the extraordinary film that's nothing short of astonishing. The Apostle."

Ark (2005) Opening and Prologue Scene[]

"This was the planet Eseon, 400 years ago."

"The Ark."

"Wating."

Armageddon (1998) Teaser[]

"There are those who think that margin shuttles into outer space is a routine matter. But in this case, it's a matter...of our planet's survival. The mission: land on comet the size of Texas before it...lands on us."

"Produced by Jerry Bruckheimer. Directed by Michael Bay."

Army of One (1993) Trailer[]

The Arrival (1996)[]

Trailer[]

"They've branded his fury paranoid and the only ones who believe what's coming are the ones who've already arrived. Stop watching the skies, start watching your back. Charlie Sheen, Ron Silver, The Arrival."

Demo VHS Trailer[]

"Critics across America are raving about The Arrival. $15 million at the box office on 1700 screens. 'Creepier and more tense than Twister and Mission Impossible.' (Pittsburgh Tribune) Starring Charlie Sheen, Ron Silver, Teri Polo and Lindsay Crouse. 'David Twohy makes an impressive debut.' (New York Post)"

"Buy the pre-pack which includes six copies of The Arrival and you'll receive a free The Making of Arrival; Stargate, the director-endorsed limited edition, with 9 new moments of previously unseen footage and an official Arrival hooded sweatshirt. The Arrival has a 60-day pay-per-view and an 8 month cable holdback, with so much critical acclaim and $16 million in P & A, including an Arrival website. Consumers are anxiously awaiting."

"The Arrival, from LIVE Entertainment."

Artisan Entertainment Video Promo[]

"Coming on in 20 minutes..."

"Video. It's the only way to get what you want to watch when you want to watch it."

"Action. Adventure. Horror. Comedy. Drama. Suspense. Romance. Great entertainment. Always a great value."

"These movies and many more are available at your local video store."

The Associate (1996) Trailer[]

"Laurel Ayres...was having a hard time making it in a man's world...until she made up a man of her own."

"She's created an imaginary partner...but she's doing all the work...and he's getting all the credit."

"Academy Award winner Whoopi Goldberg. This fall, the most successful man on Wall Street is a woman. The Associate."

Atlantic City (1981) Trailer[]

"Atlantic City. It will change every idea you ever had about winning and losing."

"Susan Sarandon, she has the ambition. Burt Lancaster has the experience."

"Alone, they might not make it. Together, they might not survive because they're betting their lives on one big score."

"Burt Lancaster...Susan Sarandon...Atlantic City, for everyone who's ever needed one more chance."

Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me (1999) Teaser[]

"Years ago, a battle was fought, and an empire was destroyed. Now, the saga will continue."

"If you see only one movie this summer, see Star Wars! But if you see TWO movies, see...Austin Powers! ...The Spy Who Shagged Me."

Austin Powers in Goldmember (2002) Trailer[]

"He is brilliant. He is deadly. And he is still surrounded by frickin' idiots."

"This summer...secrets will be revealed...an evil pact...a dangerous mission...a foxy partner...a family secret."

"Now, it's time to face the truth. On July 26...can you keep a secret?"

"New Line Cinema presents...Mike Myers...introducing Beyonce Knowles...and Michael Caine...Austin Powers in Goldmember. Opens July 26."

Avid Home Eentertainment's Schwarzenegger Videos Demo VHS Promo[]

An Awfully Big Adventure (1995) Trailer[]

Baby Geniuses (1999) Trailer[]

"They may look innocent, but if you think babies know what's going on, they're going to give you an education. And if Dr. Kinder has her way, their genius will be her claim to fame."

"TriStar Pictures presents the story at what can happen if babies know too much, talk too well and get a little too big for their diapers. Get ready, naps are history."

"Kathleen Turner, Christopher Lloyd, Kim Cattrall, and Ally McBeal's Peter MacNical. Baby Geniuses."

Baby's Day Out (1994) Trailer[]

"Baby Bink had it all, but he wanted more. So he went, out the door. Now, 3 wise guys out for easy money, are finding out just how hard catching a baby can be. He'll take them new places, show them new faces, but he isn'tabout to let anyone spoil his day. From John Hughes, the creator of Home Alone. Baby's Day Out. Directed by Patrick Read Johnson."

Baby's Day Out (1994) Stay Tuned Indent[]

"Stay tuned after the movie to see how you can become part of the adventures of Baby Bink in the Hi Tech Entertainment video game version of Baby's Day Out."

Baby's Day Out (1994) Video Game Promo[]

"It's Baby's Day Out: The Video Game from Hi-Tech Entertainment."

"Baby's Day Out: The Video Game."

The Bachelor (1999)[]

Trailer[]

"New Line Cinema presents, Chris O'Donnell, Renee Zellweger, in a comedy that asks who would you choose, where did you turn, and how fast could you run."

"The Bachelor."

"Get a wife November 1999"

UK Trailer[]

"New Line Cinema presents Chris O'Donnell, Renee Zellweger, Artie Langue, Ed Asner, Hal Holbrook, James Cromell, Marley Shelton, Stacy Edwards, Mariah Carey, Sarah Silverman, Brooke Shields, Jennifer Esposito as Daphne, and Peter Ustinov, in a comedy that proves with no place to hide or will become."

"The Bachelor."

"Get a wife this February."

TV Spot[]

"What would you do for 100 million dollars? Jimmie Shannon has to get married in 24 hours to save his wife. The Bachelor. Rated PG-13. Coming to theaters November 5th."

Video Trailer[]

"New Line Cinema presents, Chris O'Donnell, Renee Zellweger, in a comedy that asks who would you choose, where did you turn, and how fast could you run."

"The Bachelor."

"Coming soon to DVD and videocassette. (Alt 1: Coming to videocassette and DVD April 18th, 2000). (Alt 2: Now available on DVD and videocassette)."

Bachelor Party (1984) Trailer[]

"20th Century Fox has brought you stories of love, war, adventure. Now, another classic tale. Rick Gassko is a man who lives to love. A man with talent, good taste, good friends, good news. His bride, Debbie, was raised in a different world. A man, a woman, a bachelor party for him, a bridal shower for her, a night to encounter ex-boyfriends, ex-girlfriends, ex-men and excitement. 20th Century Fox invites you to witness a tradition no one will discuss in public. A motion picture event you can't afford to miss. Bachelor Party, starring Tom Hanks, a man's tradition every woman should know about."

Backdraft (1991) TV Spot[]

"Was this an incident, arson or murder? That will come between brothers and separate lovers. Tomorrow night at a special sneak preview from director Ron Howard: Backdraft. Rated R."

Back in the USSR (1992) Trailer[]

Bad Dreams (1988)[]

Trailer[]

"Sometimes, a single moment of madness...can last a lifetime. And sometimes, your worst nightmares begin the moment you wake up."

"Can you survive bad dreams? Take a stab at it. March 25th."

Video Promo[]

"He led 24 people to sacrifice their lives. Now, he's back from the grave...for the one that got away."

"Can you survive bad dreams? Take a stab at it."

Bad Girls (1994)[]

Trailer[]

"All they wanted was a fresh start. They had no rights, they had no justice, and no one to stand up for them. They didn't want this kind of life, they didn't ask for this kind of trouble. But fate turned 4 women into friends, four friends into fugitives and 4 reluctant heroes into legends. Bad Girls."

Video Trailer[]

"The town called them outlaws. They called it justice. Madeline Stowe, Mary Stewart Masterson, Drew Barrymore and Andie McDowell. The only way they stand a chance, is to stand together. Bad Girls."

TV Spot[]

"In a time ruled by outlaws, in a town ruled by fear, they weren't looking for trouble, but when no one would stand up for them, they had no choice but to stand up for themselves. Bad Girls. Rated R. Starts Friday at theaters everywhere."

Bad Influence (1990) Trailer[]

"Bad Influence. All he ever wanted was a big piece of the good life. Now, he's about to find out that what he wants and what he's afraid are really one and the same. He never saw that coming, until this was too late. Now, there's no way out. Rob Lowe, James Spader. He got everything he wanted and lost everything he had. Bad Influence."

Bad Lieutenant (1992) Demo VHS Trailer[]

Barbarian Queen II: The Empress Strikes Back (1990) Demo VHS Trailer[]

Bartok the Magnificent (1999) Trailer[]

"20th Century Fox proudly presents, from the animators who brought you Anastasia. A land of mystery, a kingdom in peril and to save the day. An albino bat? Bartok the Magnificent. Everyone's favorite bat is back in an all-new adventure that kids will love with a new cast of characters. Bartok the Magnificent features five new songs from the Tony Award-winning composers of Ragtime and Anastasia. Featuring the voice talents of Hank Azaria as Bartok, Jennifer Tilly as Piloff and Kelsey Grammer as Zozi. This November, it's all the courage, all the strength, all the heart of a great hero. Bartok the Magnificent, a hilarious family movie that kids will want to see again and again."

Barton Fink (1991) Trailer[]

"For the first time in the history of the Cannes Film Festival, one film has swept all the major awards; Barton Fink. A new film by Joel and Ethan Coen."

BASEketball (1998) Trailer[]

"In a world where professional sports had sunk to a new low, two guys invented a game...that took them to the big time."

"From the director of Naked Gun and starring the creators of South Park...comes a story about their rise to stardom...the fans who adored them...and the forces...that drove them apart."

"Universal Pictures presents...Trey Parker...Matt Stone...Yasmine Bleeth...Jenny McCarthy...Robert Vaughn...and Academy Award winner Ernest Borgnine."

"This summer, experience the passion and triumph...BASEketball."

Basket Case 2 (1990)[]

Trailer[]

"This time, he's not alone."

VHS Sales Promo[]

"Everybody's talking about Basket Case 2. After a smash debut, it's currently burning up the box office at theaters across the nation. The trailer is playing alone at over 1000 screens, brought to you from the same filmmaker that created Basket Case and Brain Damage. Basket Case 2 is making the critics stand up and cheer in print and on television. Like Joe Bob Briggs, just listen to what he had to say on The Tonight Show!"

"And on Good Day New York, they spent an entire show live on the set."

"On MTV, Basket Case 2 rocked them with a smash review."

"And on Entertainment Tonight, it shined right up there with the other stars, even Dr. Ruth couldn't resist giving her diagnosis for Basket Case 2."

"So follow the doctor's orders and put all your eggs in this basket, because when Basket Case 2 comes to home video, we're hitting the market from all angles. We'll start the campaign with network television (ABC, CBS, NBC) and radio, both before and after the street date. You'll see Basket Case 2 print ads in major national magazines (Rolling Stone, Fangoria, Cinefantastique, Billboard). We'll even tempt your customers right in your store with a fully-animated three-dimensional mobile. Order Basket Case 2 in the special two-packs for just $159.96, and save $20 over single purchases. We're coming out strong for Basket Case 2. It's the critics' choice and the public's hungry for it. Order by May 8th, because it runs wild in the streets on May 24. Basket Case 2. Put all your eggs in this basket!"

Batman (1989)[]

Trailer[]

TV Spot 1[]

"Rated PG-13. June 23rd."

TV Spot 2[]

"The real story, the love story, A woman in danger, A hero in black. The adventure you've been waiting for. Rated PG-13. Now playing at a theater near you."

TV Spot 3[]

"Rated PG-13. Now playing at a theater near you."

TV Spot 4[]

"Batman. The critics call it spectacular says Gannett Newspapers. Gene Shalit says Jack Nicholson is colossal. CBS TV says it's a terrific time at the movies. And Rolling Stone Magazine declares it a triumph. You can't take your eyes off it. Critics rave Batman could be the movie of the decade. Rated PG-13. Now playing."

Batman & Mr. Freeze: SubZero (1998) Trailer[]

Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker (2000)[]

Video Promos[]

"Now on video, the first ever full-length Batman Beyond movie. In this battle, evil has many faces, but only one is capable of turning Gotham inside out. The Joker is back, and this time, Batman will face him alone in a clash that can only be seen in this full-length movie. Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker, now available on videocassette and DVD."

Batman: Mask of the Phantasm (1993)[]

Trailer[]

"This Christmas, for the first time, America's most exciting and legendary motion picture hero, comes to the screen like you've never seen him before...in an all-new, larger than life, feature film. Now, The Dark Knight confronts his newest, and most menacing villain...The Phantasm...and faces his greatest danger."

"A soaring new adventure. Batman: Mask of the Phantasm, the animated movie. Coming for a Christmas you'll never forget."

TV Spot 1[]

"Now, America's most exciting and legendary movie hero, comes to the big screen like you've never seen him before, and faces his greatest danger, The Phantasm...in a soaring new full-length motion picture adventure! Batman: Mask of the Phantasm. Rated PG. Starts December 25th, only in theaters."

TV Spot 2[]

"America's most exciting movie hero battles his newest arch-enemy, The Phantasm, in an all-new full-length feature film, Batman: Mask of the Phantasm. Rated PG. Starts December 25th, only in theaters."

TV Spot 3[]

"America's most exciting and legendary movie hero comes to the big screen in an all-new full-length feature film. Now, Batman faces his newest arch-enemy, The Phantasm, as he continues to battle the never-ending pranks of...The Joker."

"Batman: Mask of the Phantasm. Rated PG. Starts December 25th, only in theaters."

TV Spot 4[]

"Now, are you ready...for the biggest, most exciting, action-packed animated movie ever on the big screen? Batman: Mask of the Phantasm. The Dark Knight fights his most awesome villain, The Phantasm, plus, faces every danger the crime-ridden streets of Gotham City can offer up. Batman: Mask of the Phantasm. Rated PG. Starts December 25th, only in theaters."

Video Trailer[]

"Now, are you ready...for the biggest, most exciting, action-packed animated movie ever on the big screen? Batman: Mask of the Phantasm. Buena Vista 1994 Academy Award Nominations Promo[]

"The ballots have gone out, the nominations are in. It's time for the world's most glamorous entertainment event, the Academy Awards. And some of the biggest and most nominated of these films are coming soon to home video. From the #1 film of 1994 to a critically acclaimed collection of comedy, intrigue, passion, mystery and action films, one studio has brought it all to you. 22 nominations for Miramax and 10 for the Walt Disney Studios, including two nominations for Best Picture, four nominations for Best Director and four each for Best Supporting Actor and Actress. Now, Buena Vista Home Video is proud to present its 1994 Academy Award nominees."

"From Miramax Home Entertainment comes Pulp Fiction. Director Quentin Tarantino's sizzling action hit came up with seven big nominations in the Oscar derby, including Best Picture, Best Director, Best Screenplay, Best Supporting Actor for Samuel L. Jackson and Best Supporting Actress for Uma Thurman, and with his nomination for Best Actor, John Travolta's amazing performance has been called a career high. Pulp Fiction was also one of the year's most critically acclaimed films, with Time Magazine raving, 'Pulp Fiction towers over the year's other movies!' And Entertainment Weekly proclaiming it, 'The most exhilarating piece of filmmaking to come along in years.' Pulp Fiction also stars action hero Bruce Willis and two of this year's Academy Award nominees for Best Supporting Actress and Actor, Uma Thurman and Samuel L. Jackson. Don't miss it on video."

"The next recipient of multiple Academy Award nominations is Hollywood Pictures Home Video's Quiz Show. This hit movie from director Robert Redford has been nominated for four Academy Awards, Best Picture, Best Director for Robert Redford, Best Supporting Actor for Paul Scofield and Best Screenplay. Audiences and critics oved Quiz Show and you don't need help with the answer why. It's the movie on more than 83 1994 top-ten lists. It's been called 'Redford's best film.' It's Quiz Show."

"From Miramax Home Entertainment comes Queen Margot. The internationally acclaimed hit Queen Margot, starring international superstar Isabelle Adjani, has been honored with an Academy Award nomination for Best Costume Design. USA Today gave it four stars and called it 'one of the year's best films.' The Los Angeles Times says, 'Isabelle Adjani burns a hole in the screen' as Queen Margot."

"Touchstone Home Video's Ed Wood received two Academy Award nominations. Tim Burton's hilarious comedy of a moviemaker with a dream has been nominated for Martin Landau's stunning performance as Bela Lugosi, which is considered the favorite in the category of Best Supporting Actor. Critics call it one of the year's funniest films. Siskel and Ebert give it two big thumbs up."

"From Miramax Home Entertainment comes Tom & Viv. Miranda Richardson has been honored with a nomination for Best Actress and Rosemary Harris for Best Supporting Actress. Tom & Viv is the true story of the stormy marriage of famed author T.S. Eliot and his eccentric wife Vivienne. It also stars Willem Dafoe in a critically acclaimed role. Siskel and Ebert said of their performances, 'Willem Dafoe and Miranda Richardson are superb' as Tom & Viv."

"From Miramax Home Entertainment comes Heavenly Creatures. This amazing true story of a murder that shocked a nation has been nominated for Best Screenplay written directly for the screen. It's been called one of 1994's ten best films by Time Magazine, the Los Angeles Times, the Boston Sunday Globe, the Chicago Sun-Times and Entertainment Weekly. Heavenly Creatures."

"From Miramax Home Entertainment comes Bullets Over Broadway. This sparkling comedy about life in the theater really hit the big time in the Oscar race, grabbing seven big Academy Award nominations including Best Director for Woody Allen, Best Screenplay, Best Supporting Actor for Chazz Palminteri and two nominations for Best Supporting Actress, Jennifer Tilly and Dianne Wiest. USA Today assures us 'a howling good time guaranteed' for Bullets Over Broadway."

"From Miramax Home Entertainment comes Red. It's a seductive mystery starring Irene Jacob, but it's no mystery why Red has earned three Academy Award nominations including Best Screenplay and Best Director for Krzysztof Kielowski. Over 40 critics across the nation are calling it one of the year's ten best movies. It's Red and it's hot."

"From Walt Disney Home Video comes their biggest hit ever, The Lion King. The #1 movie at the box office in 1994 is being honored for its incredible music. With four Academy Award nominations, one for Best Original Score for Hans Zimmer and three nominations in the category of Best Original Song: Hakuna Matata, Can You Feel the Love Tonight and Circle of Life, all written by Elton John and Tim Rice. It's an entertainment phenomenon that's in a class by itself, and now, it's available for a limited time on videocassette. Walt Disney Pictures' The Lion King."

"Mark your ballots, cast your votes for Best Actor, Best Picture, Best Screenplay and many, many more. In the weeks and months to come, you'll be able to enjoy all these Academy Award nominees on videocassette from Buena Vista Home Video."
